question.body: Which cell type would typically be the smallest?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A red blood cell tends to be 6-9 micrometers in diameter.
Incorrect. The diameter of a white blood cell ranges from 9-20 micrometers, depending on the type.
Correct. Platelets are smaller than the other cells. Normal platelets tend to be 2-3 micrometers in diameter.

part.hint: Consider the basic physical characteristics of each cell type.
